title: Opportunities for Urban Regeneration in Belgrade's Periphery

author: Danica Jovović Prodanović, BINA - Belgrade International Architecture Week

segmentation: Good morning for everybody.
It's great to be in Lublin again and we'd like her again from our behalf to thank our wonderful hosts and the leader of the project.

And it's great to be the part of the future architecture platform and to present the part of what we as Belgrade International Week of Architecture did as the part of future architecture platform program during the 2017 and also 2016.
So the Belgrade international equals founded with the idea to promote, present and discuss architecture, addressing both professional and general audience.
The significant part of the Vilna program, he is dedicated to the Publix topics related to state and development of the City of Belgrade and and consequently to all big cities as such.

So in the second year of the future architecture platform with Indovina Festival, we organized the Future Architecture Conference under the title Belgrade outskirts Envision Future that was dedicated to the topic of urban suburbia.
One of the burning issues of the future development of the city is the development of the municipalities on the outskirts.
They're connectedness with the center, OK, so suburban Belgrade covers a huge territory that is combination.
Of urban, rural and industrial areas, it is rich in natural and cultural resources.
The riverbanks zones of the Sava and Danube archaeological sites.
Uh.
Cultural monuments or outing spots.
However, they are also on numerous issues such as the non existence and or disregard of town planning regulations, illegal construction and the poor network of plumbing and drains roads and streets.
So it's a abandoned.
There is a lot of abandoned.
Abandoned buildings and a lot of decay and bad lack of infrastructure in public places.
Dimension state of suburban municipalities coupled with the constant influx of citizens, refugees and migrants.
Poverty and the high degree of unemployment are universal topics and present in all urban environments.
That is why we decided to bring the outskirts of Belgrade and their development into the focus of the.
Future Architecture Platform Conference of 2017.
The conference was organized in Urban Planning Institute of Belgrade.
It lasted for two days within the 12 and it was 12 and 13th of May, and it was the part of the Vilna Festival during this.
Conference the first part.
We had a little introduction and we want to present other other members.
Some members of the platform which we feel that is also very important for our network, so we managed to present the Lisbon being a channel of architecture.
Maxim museum.
Andy Pierre, Barcelona and afterwards we had the opportunity to hear the presentations of tank 10 emerging architects, planners and activists.
And artists on the subject of the outskirts, Belgrade, outskirts and outskirts urban outskirts as such.
On the set.
Continue for one part of our conference.
We organized this field trip that cover.
It was about 60 kilometers field trip on the outskirts of Belgrade that was guided by one of our very famous urban planners, Mudrik Fencik, and we wanted to.
Show to our participants water what is really the situation in the outskirts of Belgrade.
Covering all these topics that I mentioned urban rural industrial postindustrial situations in Belgrade.
So these are.
A few photos from this.
Field trip
And one of our.
Participants was the team that we invited from London coming from London.
The TARDIS consisted of three actually Greek people, funny Castoro, Demetrius Grosse Opalescent efficacy.
Marty, who.
Their proposal was activate modern ruins, and in all these suburban areas there is a lot of this modern ruins not only in suburban areas but in suburban areas.
There is a lot of them in our country.
They are not only the.
Result of social and economical situation.
As in many countries it is also a lot of inadequate maintenance.
The result of consequence of the warfare in the region.
So we felt like this is a very important subject to.
To talk about if we're talking of the problem of the future of the suburban areas, so that is that was the reason why we invited this group of young architects and planners.
So now I give a floor too funny, castoro, the member and representative of this team to tell us what they did in Belgrade.
And further after the variables.
Thank you.
